# Web Application Interface

The Mol-View-Stories web application aims to provide a straighforward way to write stories.  A `Story` is a set of scenes that share some common global settings and the story panels are where you can modify these settings.
Within the `Scene` panels you can specify per-scene settings and in the Top Panel you can download your stories or , if you are logged in you can save them to the cloud.


## Story Panels

A `Story` is a set of scenes that share some common global settings and the story panels are where you can modify these settings.

Stories consist of `Story`
The story panel is where global information about a story goes.  Str
- Story metadata editor
- Scene list and navigation
- Scene options and settings
- Assets management

## Scene Panels


### Scene Code Panel

The code in this panel will be combined with the `Story` code and executed to render the scene. A live preview is available to the right. The editor has:

- Syntax highlighting
- Auto-completion
- Code execution (Ctrl/Cmd+S)
- Error highlighting

![](img/scene_code.png)

### Scene Options Panel

The scene options panel allows you to write your markdown content for the scene. You can add text, images, and other elements to enhance the scene's appearance and functionality.
You can also specify scene-level metadata:

- Header
- key ( internal scene name that can be referenced ).
- linger/transition  duration



![](img/scene_options.png)


## Top Menu Bar

The top menu bar provides access to file operations, saving/publishing, and story management. From here you can download stories in various formats, save private sessions, publish public stories, and access your saved work. See [Cloud Storage & Sharing](webapp-cloud-storage.qmd) for details.

![](img/top_panel.png)
